intro: Ayenia voulily, commonly known as the Voulily ayenia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Ayenia voulily is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or grassland habitats. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
